mdes.slick.sui.event
Class MouseEvent

java.lang.Object
  mdes.slick.sui.event.EventObject
      mdes.slick.sui.event.MouseEvent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class MouseEvent
extends EventObject

A mouse event, including motion and press/release. Mouse events will hold the absolute and local x and y positions and often the button that is pressed.

Since:
b.0.2
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

MouseEvent

public MouseEvent(java.lang.Object source,
                  int id,
                  int button,
                  int x,
                  int y,
                  int ox,
                  int oy,
                  int absx,
                  int absy)
Creates a new mouse event with the specified params.

Parameters:
source - the source
id - the event type id
button - the button index or -1 if it's unknown/undefined
x - the x position of the mouse when the event occurred
y - the y position of the mouse when the event occurred
ox - the old x position
oy - the old y position
absx - the absolute x position to the game container
absy - the absolute y position to the game container

MouseEvent

public MouseEvent(java.lang.Object source,
                  int id,
                  int button,
                  int x,
                  int y,
                  int absx,
                  int absy)
Creates a new mouse event with the specified params. The old x and y values will be equal to the x and y values using this constructor.

Parameters:
source - the source
id - the event type id
button - the button index or -1 if it's unknown/undefined
x - the x position of the mouse when the event occurred
y - the y position of the mouse when the event occurred
absx - the absolute x position to the game container
absy - the absolute y position to the game container

MouseEvent

public MouseEvent(java.lang.Object source,
                  int id,
                  int x,
                  int y,
                  int absx,
                  int absy)
Creates a new mouse event with the specified params. The old x and y values will be equal to the x and y values using this constructor. Also, the button index will be -1, equal to NOBUTTON.

Parameters:
source - the source
id - the event type id
x - the x position of the mouse when the event occurred
y - the y position of the mouse when the event occurred
absx - the absolute x position to the game container
absy - the absolute y position to the game container
Method Detail

getOldX

public int getOldX()
Gets the old x value before the mouse position was changed.

Returns:
the old x position, local to the parent container

getOldY

public int getOldY()
Gets the old y value before the mouse position was changed.

Returns:
the old y position, local to the parent container

getAbsoluteX

public int getAbsoluteX()
Gets the absolute x position relative to the GameContainer.

Returns:
the absolute x position

getAbsoluteY

public int getAbsoluteY()
Gets the absolute y position relative to the GameContainer.

Returns:
the absolute y position

getX

public int getX()
Gets the x position relative to the parent container.

Returns:
the x position in the container's local space

getY

public int getY()
Gets the y position relative to the parent container.

Returns:
the y position in the container's local space

getButton

public int getButton()
Gets the button that initiated the event, or NOBUTTON if no mouse button was used.

Returns:
the button index (starting at 0, conforming to the button constants BUTTON1, BUTTON2 and BUTTON3) or NOBUTTON (-1) if it's unknown
